attributes.action: Show full details of bills and amendments on the result of votes page.
attributes.additional_details: After the vote in the commons on the child protect Bill. We the people were only able to know the full text of the amendment due to an MP putting it online. The site should have it with each result showing who voted for and against.
attributes.background: On the website when the results of each vote is shown. That you also put the text of what they vote for or against so the people can read it for themselves.

rejection.details:
We can't publish petitions when the request is something that's already happening or something that has been announced since you started your petition.

We think your petition is covered by Government or Parliament action already. If you'd like something else, you could start a new petition clearly explaining what it is.

The Official Report, also known as Hansard already publishes the text of any amendment being voted on alongside the division result in its report on the debate. This is ussually published within a few hours of the debate. See https://hansard.parliament.uk/. 

The text of Bills and any amendments proposed to them are also published on the website for each Bill, which you can find via https://bills.parliament.uk/. Other motions and amendments are published in the Order Paper which is avalible via https://commonsbusiness.parliament.uk/.
